text:
Hey all, wanted to drop a📝 for accountability.

I usually don’t go on FOX on principle, but misinformation about coronavirus has made me concerned about risk.

As a result I decided to go on @BretBaier to discuss coronavirus response + make the case for paid leave, Medicaid, etc

The NBA, MLS, Houston Rodeo, SXSW and others are making the right call to cancel and postpone large events. The time to act is now. Avoid large groups, work from home if you can, and WASH YOUR HANDS.  If we work together, we can flatten the curve and defeat this virus.

RT @AdyBarkan There are still some adults in the room. Thank you @SpeakerPelosi!

Our campaign continues to win the vast majority of the votes of younger people.

In order to win in the future, you need to win the voters who represent the future of our country, and you must speak to the issues of concern to them.

That is how you defeat Donald Trump.

We need to dramatically expand #COVIDー19 testing and *processing* capacity.

Sadly true. We allowed our domestic manufacturing capacity to atrophy because it was cheaper & more efficient to have it made abroad. #Covid_19 is exposing this in the medical field. But this dangerous supply chain deficiency extends to dozens of other critical industries. https://twitter.com/nkingofdc/status/1238232669609222147 QT @NKingofDC We're going to to try to ramp up production of respirators and virus tests, etc., only to realize we have to turn to other countries for that. This isn't the pre-WWII USA anymore.

We don’t.

We've been told over and over that Medicare for All is "too radical."

I think it's radical to have a health care system that leaves 87 million people uninsured or underinsured.

I think it's radical that people can't afford to see a doctor during a pandemic.
If there ever was a moment that showed us the need for all people to be able to get health care regardless of their income, this is that moment. Medicare for All now.
